message.entry: Error evaluating expression ''{0}'' for ''{1}'' in block diagram ''{2}'': {3}
The input value ''{0}'' specified for ''{1}'' is not valid
Block ''{0}'' does not support operating point save or restore.
Block ''{0}'' does not support stepping back.
Block ''{0}'' does not support Fast restart mode.
Block ''{0}'' does not support Fast restart mode or stepping back.
Stepping back cannot be enabled for model ''{0}'' for the following reasons:
Fast restart mode cannot be enabled for model ''{0}'' for the following reasons:
Neither Fast restart mode nor stepping back can be enabled for the model ''{0}'' for the following reasons:
Stepping back can not be enabled as profiling is turned on.
Fast restart can not be enabled as profiling is turned on.
Neither Fast restart nor Stepping back can be enabled as profiling is turned on.
Stepping back cannot be enabled for model ''{0}''. Please refer to the Diagnostic Viewer for details.
Fast restart mode cannot be enabled for model ''{0}''. Please refer to the Diagnostic Viewer for details.
Unable to override the compliance level for model ''{0}''.
Fast restart mode relies on the ability to save the model''s operating point. However, the following error occurred when an attempt was made to save the operating point:
Fast restart and the option of stepping back both rely on the ability to save the model''s operating point. However, the following error occurred when an attempt was made to save the operating point:
Stepping back relies on the ability to save the model''s operating point. However, the following error occurred when an attempt was made to save the operating point:
Block "{0}" does not support stepping back. Its output will be incorrect upon stepping back or after simulation restarts in Fast restart mode.
Some of the blocks, which are not critical for correct simulation result, do not support stepping back.
Step forward before stepping back.
Specify the number of steps by which simulation will step forward or back
Toggle the ability to step back the simulation
Specify the number of simulation steps to save for stepping back (impacts memory usage)
Specify the frequency of saving simulation steps for stepping back (impacts speed of simulation)
Model associated with the SimulationStepper object was closed

Model ''{0}'' contains SimEvents blocks from an older release (prior to R2016a). These blocks do not support stepping back with the Simulation Stepper. Consider replacing these blocks with SimEvents blocks from later releases (R2016a and later).

Model ''{0}'' contains SimEvents blocks from an older release (prior to R2016a). These blocks do not support Fast Restart. Consider replacing these blocks with SimEvents blocks from later releases (R2016a and later).
Fast restart is disabled.
Fast restart is disabled for model "{0}".
Some block states might be inconsistent with the simulation time because an error occurred while stepping back in the simulation of model "{0}". Click here to stop the simulation.
Block diagram ''{0}'' must be compiled in order to save its operating point.
Simulation of ''{0}'' must be paused in order to save its operating point.
Stepping back in simulation is not supported when the <sldiag objui="configset" objparam= "LoggingToFile">"Log Dataset data to file"</sldiag> parameter is enabled.
Fast restart and stepping back in simulation are not supported when the <sldiag objui="configset" objparam= "LoggingToFile">"Log Dataset data to file"</sldiag> parameter is enabled.
The model ''{0}'' contains blocks that are not compliant with min, max and overflow logging in fast restart workflow.
Array of Simulink.SimulationInput objects is not supported.
Stepping back is not supported because RoadRunner is driving the simulation of model "{0}".
Fast restart and stepping back are not supported because RoadRunner is driving the simulation of model "{0}".
Stepping back is not supported for model "{0}" because one or more referenced models use local solvers.
